intro: Athroisma gracile subsp. psyllioides, commonly known as the slender hairgrass, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its fine, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along stream banks. It has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread vegetatively and form dense mats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
